Commentary.ab: Y11.6a zānāite] Geldner, Kellens, Pirart; Bartholomae zānaite. Kellens, 2007 p.88 "La bonne représentation de la voyelle ē̌ suggère une simple corruption de *zaiiete", but ē̌ is actually hardly attested in mss.; Pirart, 2004 p. 343 as 3rd sg. pres. subj. med of a present stem zānā-: "le prés. kryādi zānā- / zān- est ahurique et le divādi zā̌iia- non préverbé est daivique" (but. cf. e.g. V1.17 yaɱāi zaiiata ϑraētaōnō Pirart, 2004 p. 343, n. 124).

And the yazad Hōm curses that person, he says: (~ Y11.4-7) "May you not have children, and may dishonour and other afflictions be yours, you who do not use me in worship. Nor do you consecrate the meal which (my) father Ohrmazd gave to me the jaw along with the tongue and left eye of all beneficent animals, and the varieties of beneficent animals you do not consecrate (for me), but you devour (it)! Whoever does not consecrate that food which my father Ohrmazd gave to me, but devours it, in his house will be born neither priest nor warrior nor husband man. In his house people of the line of sorcerers will be born, and will destroy the creations of Ohrmazd. (He is) the miscreator who ruins things, and (even if) he will undertake many duties and obligations, he will bring nothing at all to completion, and I shall bind him in the spiritual slate with those bonds with which I bound Frasyab the Tūr."
